metadata.title: path-to-regexp: path-to-regexp Unpatched `path-to-regexp` ReDoS in 0.1.x (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The CVE program describes this issue as: path-to-regexp turns path strings into a regular expressions. In certain cases, path-to-regexp will output a regular expression that can be exploited to cause poor performance. The regular expression that is vulnerable to backtracking can be generated in the 0.1.x release of path-to-regexp. Upgrade to 0.1.12. This vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-45296. 
            STATEMENT: This vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-45296.
            MITIGATION: Avoid using two parameters within a single path segment, when the separator is not . (e.g. no /:a-:b). Alternatively, you can define the regex used for both parameters and ensure they do not overlap to allow backtracking.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
thunderbird is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
